Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= man; ► king of Bashan (בָּשָׁן) defeated by Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans purposefully move in the direction of (another) human, deity, or object to engage with them
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= town; ◄ Bashan (בָּשָׁן) ► part of kingdom of Og (עֹוג) and later assigned to Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which an area has been made inaccessible and strong, beyond the reach of others, such as enemies, ◄ usually by surrounding it by a high wall

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

= a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability
a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, attached in horizontal position to a gate so that it cannot be opened from the outside
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= population centers without fortifications ► and therefore hard to defend; ≈ possibly associated with living in security without fear of the enemy

= town; ◄ territory of Naphtali (נַפְתָּלִי) at Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת)
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

literally: the sea of salt; hence: = a large body of salt water located in the basin of the Jordan Valley, east of Judah; the Jordan River flows from the north into the northern part of this sea; the water is so salty that no living organism inhabits them

literally: the sea of salt; hence: = a large body of salt water located in the basin of the Jordan Valley, east of Judah; the Jordan River flows from the north into the northern part of this sea; the water is so salty that no living organism inhabits them
= literally: Sea of Salt; one of the names of the Dead Sea, because of the high concentration of salt in its water
= side of a mountain or hill
= a mountain, ◄ part of the Abarim (עֲבָרִים) range, located in Moab (מֹואָב) northeast of the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
literally: the rising (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions
= action by which humans make themselves strong and powerful by putting on armor
= member of same family, clan, tribe, or ethnic group
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as a child of that attribute, attitude, or behavior

= state in which a human being, animal, or deity is deemed worthy of respect because of characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

= children dependent on their mothers for care; ≈ in this sense usually occurring in a variant of the expression טַף וְנָשִׁים children and women, often with possessives, indicating their belonging to families headed by an adult male; ≈ associated with vulnerability and lack of strength
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= member of same family, clan, tribe, or ethnic group
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= an area that has become someone's possession, which often implies that this possession has been granted by God and that it will be passed on to the next generation of the new owner
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man, also known as Hoshea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and Jeshua (יֵשׁוּעַ) ◄ son of Nun (נוּן) tribe of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land; his name was Hoshea, later changed by Moses to Joshua (יְהֹושֻׁעַ) Moses' assistant, who later became his successor and brought Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) into Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans or deities engage in a confrontation with (other) humans

= action by which humans or deities start performing an event
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status

literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power
= state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= a mountain, ◄ part of the Abarim (עֲבָרִים) range, located in Moab (מֹואָב) northeast of the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: the sea; = a cardinal direction pointing towards the west, ◄ which, in Israel, is the direction towards the Mediterranean Sea
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= area located to the south of a point of reference
literally: the rising (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
